page.title: 06Farming, Murroes
page.content: Most of the farming in the area is a mixture of arable and stock breeding for meat production. There is also a small amount of fruit farming. The increased use of machinery and contractors to do such jobs as ploughing and crop spraying has meant a decrease in the number of farm workers. Chemical fertilisers are commonly used nowadays. There is a fear that, as more farms are taken over by firms or groups, things will become more difficult for the smaller family farms. In the autumn, children are employed to help with potato lifting, and the schools close in October for a week's{"Tattie Holiday"}
